vectorData.altText: 30. The longitudinally-oriented muscles of the pharynx that extend from the soft palate to the inner wall of the pharynx are the _____________________.
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.

That's right!  As the name suggests, the palatopharyngeus originates from the soft palate and inserts into the inner wall of the pharynx. It is one of the longitudinally-oriented muscles of the pharynx.

The longitudinally-oriented muscles of the pharynx are the stylopharyngeus, salpingopharyngeus and the palatopharyngeus. The stylopharyngeus enters the pharynx by passing between the superior and middle constrictors.

The longitudinally-oriented muscles of the pharynx function to raise the pharynx during swallowing. This, coordinated with the narrowing of the pharynx behind a bolus of food through contraction of the constrictors, acts to propel food downward and into the esophagus.
related to a tube; the salpingopharyngeus extends from the pharyngotympanic tube to the wall of the pharynx
